description: This scene features two octopuses in an underwater setting near a cave. One octopus confronts the other, accusingly pointing out suction marks on its tentacles. The accuser sarcastically suggests these marks were acquired at a "meeting," implying infidelity. The irony stems from using a natural biological feature of the octopus as evidence of wrongdoing. The absurdism is highlighted by octopuses engaging in human-like relationship conflict and sarcasm.
caption: “Oh, yeah? ... And I suppose you got those suction marks at the meeting, too!”
